article:
World Baseball Classic

The World Baseball Classic (WBC) is an international baseball tournament sanctioned by the World Baseball Softball Confederation (WBSC) and organized by Major League Baseball (MLB). The tournament was created to promote baseball globally and to provide a platform for the world's best players to compete against each other.

# Background

The idea of a global baseball tournament dates back to the 1990s, but it wasn't until 2005 that the WBSC and MLB announced plans to launch the World Baseball Classic. The tournament was designed to bring together the world's top baseball-playing nations, with the goal of promoting the sport and creating a more competitive international baseball landscape. The WBC is considered the premier international baseball competition, and it is often referred to as the "Olympics of Baseball."

# History

## 2006–09: Samurai Japan's back-to-back championships

The inaugural World Baseball Classic was held in 2006, with 16 teams participating in the tournament. Japan, led by manager Sadaharu Oh, won the first-ever WBC title, defeating Cuba 10-6 in the final. Japan repeated as champions in 2009, defeating South Korea 5-3 in the final. These back-to-back championships cemented Japan's status as a baseball powerhouse and helped to establish the WBC as a premier international competition.

## 2013: Direct qualification and "Plátano Power"

The 2013 WBC introduced a new qualification process, with 28 teams competing for 12 spots in the tournament. The Dominican Republic, led by manager Tony Peña, won the championship, defeating Puerto Rico 3-0 in the final. The Dominican team was nicknamed "Plátano Power" due to their dominant performance, which included a 8-0 record in the tournament.

## 2017: American redemption

The 2017 WBC was marked by a strong performance from the United States, who won their first-ever WBC title. Led by manager Jim Leyland, the U.S. team defeated Puerto Rico 8-0 in the final, ending a 10-year drought without a championship. The U.S. team was led by MVP Marcus Stroman, who pitched 4.2 scoreless innings in the final.

## 2023: "Baseball's already won"

The 2023 WBC was marked by a strong performance from Japan, who won their third championship. Led by manager Hideki Kuriyama, the Japanese team defeated the United States 3-2 in the final. The tournament was notable for its high level of competition, with many close games and exciting finishes. As Japan's manager noted, "Baseball's already won" – a sentiment that reflected the tournament's success in promoting the sport globally.

## 2026 tournament

The 2026 WBC is scheduled to take place in March 2026, with 20 teams participating in the tournament. The tournament will feature a new format, with the top 16 teams from the 2023 WBC receiving automatic qualification. The remaining four spots will be determined through a qualification process.

# Format

The World Baseball Classic is a single-elimination tournament, with teams competing in a round-robin format in the first round. The top two teams from each pool advance to the knockout stage, where they compete in a single-elimination format. The tournament culminates in a championship game, with the winner being crowned the WBC champion.

# Participation

The World Baseball Classic has featured teams from around the world, including the Americas, Asia, Europe, and Oceania. The tournament has been notable for its diverse participation, with teams from countries such as Japan, South Korea, and the Dominican Republic competing against teams from the United States, Canada, and Mexico.

# Trophy

The World Baseball Classic trophy is awarded to the winner of the tournament. The trophy is a symbol of excellence in international baseball, and it is considered one of the most prestigious awards in the sport.

# Broadcasting and promotion

The World Baseball Classic has been broadcast in over 200 countries and territories around the world. The tournament has been promoted through a variety of channels, including social media, television, and radio. The WBC has also partnered with a number of sponsors, including MLB, the WBSC, and several international brands.

# Attendance

The World Baseball Classic has consistently drawn large crowds, with attendance figures averaging over 20,000 fans per game. The tournament has been notable for its electric atmosphere, with fans from around the world coming together to support their teams.

# Venues

The World Baseball Classic has been held in a variety of venues around the world, including Japan, the United States, Mexico, and South Korea. The tournament has been notable for its state-of-the-art facilities, with many games being played in MLB stadiums.

# Results

## Performance of nations

Several countries have performed well in the World Baseball Classic, including Japan, the Dominican Republic, and the United States. These countries have consistently fielded strong teams and have been among the top performers in the tournament.

## Debut of national teams

Several national teams have made their debut in the World Baseball Classic, including Brazil, China, and Colombia. These teams have added to the tournament's diversity and have helped to promote baseball globally.

## Overview

The World Baseball Classic has been a success in promoting baseball globally and in providing a platform for the world's best players to compete against each other. The tournament has consistently drawn large crowds and has been notable for its high level of competition.

# Honors

## Most Valuable Player

The Most Valuable Player award is presented to the player who performs the best in the tournament. Past winners of the award include Ichiro Suzuki, Robinson Canó, and Marcus Stroman.

## All-WBC teams

The All-WBC teams are selected by a panel of experts and feature the best players from each position. The teams are announced at the end of the tournament and are considered a great honor for the players selected.

## Statistical leaders

The World Baseball Classic has featured several statistical leaders, including players who have led the tournament in batting average, home runs, and ERA. These leaders are announced at the end of the tournament and are considered among the best performers in the WBC.

2023 UCI Cycling World Championships

The 2023 UCI Cycling World Championships is the 96th edition of the UCI Road World Championships, the 26th edition of the UCI Mountain Bike World Championships, the 48th edition of the UCI Track Cycling World Championships, and the 22nd edition of the UCI Para-cycling Road World Championships. The championships were held in various locations around the world, with the road and para-cycling events taking place in Glasgow, Scotland, the mountain bike events in Fort William, Scotland, and the track events in Frankfurt, Germany.

# Championships and locations

The 2023 UCI Cycling World Championships consisted of four main disciplines: road cycling, track cycling, mountain biking, and para-cycling. The road and para-cycling events were held in Glasgow, Scotland, from August 3 to 13, 2023. The mountain bike events took place in Fort William, Scotland, from August 3 to 12, 2023. The track events were held in Frankfurt, Germany, from August 3 to 9, 2023.

## Road Cycling

The road cycling events were held in Glasgow, Scotland, and consisted of individual time trials and road races for men and women. The events took place on a 14.3 km circuit that started and finished in George Square, Glasgow. The circuit included a 1.2 km climb up the Glasgow Necropolis, which offered stunning views of the city.

## Track Cycling

The track cycling events were held in Frankfurt, Germany, and took place at the Frankfurt Velodrome. The events included individual and team pursuits, sprints, and keirin events for men and women.

## Mountain Biking

The mountain biking events were held in Fort William, Scotland, and consisted of cross-country and downhill events for men and women. The cross-country events took place on a 4.2 km circuit that included a variety of terrain, including hills, rocks, and technical sections. The downhill events took place on a 2.8 km course that included steep drops, jumps, and technical sections.

## Para-cycling

The para-cycling events were held in Glasgow, Scotland, and consisted of individual time trials and road races for men and women with physical disabilities. The events took place on the same circuit as the road cycling events.

# Schedule

The 2023 UCI Cycling World Championships schedule was as follows:

* August 3-13: Road and para-cycling events in Glasgow, Scotland
* August 3-12: Mountain bike events in Fort William, Scotland
* August 3-9: Track events in Frankfurt, Germany

## Road Cycling Schedule

* August 3: Men's and women's individual time trials
* August 4: Men's and women's road races

* August 6: Men's and women's team road races

## Track Cycling Schedule

article:
Free Substitution

Free substitution, also known as liberal substitution, is a rule in various sports that allows players to be substituted in and out of the game without restrictions or limitations. This rule is in contrast to other sports that have strict substitution rules, such as the NFL, where substitutions are only allowed during specific stoppages of play. The concept of free substitution is designed to promote player safety, strategy, and overall competitiveness in sports.

#Sports that allow free substitution

##Sports that allow unlimited substitution during live play

Some sports allow unlimited substitution during live play, meaning that players can be substituted in and out of the game at any time without stopping the clock. These sports include:

* Water polo: Players can be substituted during live play, and teams often use this strategy to keep fresh players in the water.
* Field hockey: Substitutions can be made during live play, allowing teams to maintain a high level of intensity.
* Lacrosse: Unlimited substitution is allowed during live play, enabling teams to keep fresh players on the field.
* Netball: Players can be substituted during live play, and teams often use this strategy to exploit weaknesses in the opposing team's defense.

##Sports that allow unlimited substitutions during stoppages of play only

Other sports allow unlimited substitutions during stoppages of play, but not during live play. These sports include:

* Basketball: Teams can make unlimited substitutions during timeouts, quarter breaks, and other stoppages of play.
* Volleyball: Substitutions can be made during timeouts and between sets, but not during live play.
* Rugby union: Unlimited substitutions are allowed during stoppages of play, but not during live play.
* Aussie rules football: Teams can make unlimited substitutions during stoppages of play, but not during live play.

#Sports with limited substitution

##Sports that allow a limited number of substitutions

Some sports have rules that limit the number of substitutions a team can make during a game. These sports include:

* Soccer: Teams are allowed three substitutions per game, unless the game goes into extra time, in which case a fourth substitution is allowed.
* Cricket: Teams are allowed two substitutions per innings, unless the game is shortened due to weather or other conditions.
* Tennis: Players are allowed one substitution per set, unless the set is a tiebreaker, in which case no substitutions are allowed.
* Badminton: Teams are allowed one substitution per game, unless the game is a doubles match, in which case two substitutions are allowed.

##Sports that only allow substitution to replace injured players

Some sports have rules that only allow substitution to replace injured players. These sports include:

* American football: Substitutions are only allowed to replace injured players, unless the game is in overtime, in which case teams can make unlimited substitutions.
* Baseball: Substitutions are only allowed to replace injured players, unless the game is in extra innings, in which case teams can make unlimited substitutions.
* Softball: Substitutions are only allowed to replace injured players, unless the game is in extra innings, in which case teams can make unlimited substitutions.
* Golf: Substitutions are only allowed to replace injured players, unless the tournament is a team event, in which case teams can make unlimited substitutions.

#Sports with mixed or hybrid systems

Some sports have rules that combine elements of free substitution and limited substitution. These sports include:

* Ice hockey: Teams are allowed unlimited substitutions during stoppages of play, but can only make six substitutions per game during live play.
* Rugby league: Teams are allowed unlimited substitutions during stoppages of play, but can only make eight substitutions per game during live play.
* Gaelic football: Teams are allowed unlimited substitutions during stoppages of play, but can only make six substitutions per game during live play.
* Hurling: Teams are allowed unlimited substitutions during stoppages of play, but can only make six substitutions per game during live play.

#See also

* Substitution (sport)
* Player substitution
* Tactical substitution
* Strategic substitution

#Notes

The rules and regulations regarding free substitution vary across different sports and leagues, and are subject to change. This article provides a general overview of the different types of substitution rules in various sports, but is not exhaustive.

Night of Champions (2023)
==========================

Night of Champions was a professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) and livestreaming event produced by WWE. It took place on May 27, 2023, at the Jeddah Super Dome in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. The event featured wrestlers from the Raw and SmackDown brands.

Production
----------

### Background

Night of Champions was first established in 2007, and it was originally a brand-exclusive event. However, in 2015, the event was discontinued. In 2023, WWE announced the return of Night of Champions, which would be held in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. The event was part of a 20-year partnership between WWE and the Saudi Arabian government.

### Storylines

The event featured a series of matches that resulted from scripted storylines, where wrestlers portrayed heroes, villains, or less distinguishable characters in scripted events that built tension and culminated in a wrestling match or series of matches.

The main storyline heading into the event was the World Heavyweight Championship Tournament, which featured eight wrestlers competing for the vacant World Heavyweight Championship. The tournament was established due to the injury of the previous champion, who was forced to relinquish the title.

Another major storyline was the rivalry between WWE Champion Seth Rollins and challenger AJ Styles. The two had been feuding for several weeks, with Styles earning a title shot at Night of Champions.

Event
------

### Preliminary matches

The event began with a match between Finn Bálor and Damian Priest for the United States Championship. Bálor won the match, retaining his title.

The next match was between Ronda Rousey and Shayna Baszler for the Raw Women's Championship. Rousey won the match, retaining her title.

The third match was between The Usos (Jey Uso and Jimmy Uso) and Sami Zayn and Kevin Owens for the Undisputed Tag Team Championship. The Usos won the match, retaining their titles.

### Main event

The main event was the final match of the World Heavyweight Championship Tournament, which featured AJ Styles and Seth Rollins competing for the vacant World Heavyweight Championship. Styles won the match, becoming the new World Heavyweight Champion.

Reception
----------

The event received generally positive reviews from critics and fans. The main event was praised for its high-quality wrestling and dramatic finish. The event was also notable for its historic significance, as it marked the return of the Night of Champions event and the establishment of a new world championship.

Aftermath
----------

### Raw

On the following episode of Raw, AJ Styles celebrated his World Heavyweight Championship win with a promo, where he thanked the fans for their support. Seth Rollins, however, was furious about his loss and demanded a rematch.

### SmackDown

On the following episode of SmackDown, The Usos celebrated their Undisputed Tag Team Championship win with a promo, where they thanked their fans for their support. Sami Zayn and Kevin Owens, however, were furious about their loss and demanded a rematch.

Results
--------

### World Heavyweight Championship Tournament

* AJ Styles defeated Shinsuke Nakamura in the quarterfinals
* Seth Rollins defeated Drew McIntyre in the quarterfinals
* AJ Styles defeated Randy Orton in the semifinals
* Seth Rollins defeated Cody Rhodes in the semifinals
* AJ Styles defeated Seth Rollins in the final

article:
Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective

Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective is a puzzle-adventure game developed and published by Capcom for the Nintendo DS handheld console. The game was released in 2010 and has since become a cult classic among gamers and puzzle enthusiasts.

# Gameplay

In Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective, players take on the role of Sissel, a ghost who has lost his memories and must navigate a series of puzzles to uncover his past and correct mistakes from his previous life. The gameplay revolves around manipulating objects and characters in the environment to progress through the story.

The game is divided into chapters, each representing a different episode in Sissel's journey. Players can interact with objects and characters by possessing and manipulating them, allowing Sissel to influence the world around him. The game features a unique "trick" system, which enables players to change the course of events by manipulating objects and characters in creative ways.

Players must use their wits to solve puzzles and progress through the story. The game features a variety of challenges, including environmental puzzles, character interactions, and timing-based challenges. The game also features a " rewind" feature, which allows players to rewind time and try again if they fail to solve a puzzle.

# Plot

The game's story follows Sissel, a ghost who has lost his memories and must navigate a series of puzzles to uncover his past. Sissel soon discovers that he has the ability to possess and manipulate objects and characters, which he uses to influence the world around him.

As Sissel progresses through the game, he uncovers a complex web of events and characters that are connected to his past. The game's story explores themes of identity, morality, and redemption, and features a cast of characters that are both quirky and relatable.

Throughout the game, Sissel must use his abilities to correct mistakes from his previous life and uncover the truth about his past. The game's story is full of twists and turns, and features a surprising finale that ties together the various plot threads.

# Development

## Art and game design

Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective was developed by a team at Capcom led by Shu Takumi, who is best known for his work on the Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney series. The game's art style is characterized by its use of vibrant colors and quirky character designs.

The game's design is centered around the "trick" system, which allows players to manipulate objects and characters in creative ways. The game's puzzles are designed to be challenging but not impossible, and the game features a variety of hints and clues to help players progress.

## Music and sound design

The game's music and sound design were composed by Yoko Shimomura, who is known for her work on the Kingdom Hearts series. The game's soundtrack features a mix of jazz and pop music, and is characterized by its upbeat and quirky tone.

The game's sound effects are also noteworthy, and feature a variety of creative and humorous sound effects that add to the game's charm.

# Release

Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective was released in 2010 for the Nintendo DS handheld console. The game was well-received by critics and players, and has since become a cult classic among gamers and puzzle enthusiasts.

## Mobile ports

In 2012, the game was ported to mobile devices, including iOS and Android. The mobile version of the game features updated graphics and sound, and is designed to take advantage of the touchscreen controls of mobile devices.

## 2023 remaster

In 2023, a remastered version of the game was released for PC, Nintendo Switch, and PlayStation 4. The remastered version features updated graphics and sound, and includes all of the content from the original game.

# Reception

Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective received widespread critical acclaim upon its release. The game's unique gameplay mechanics, quirky characters, and engaging story were praised by critics, and the game is widely regarded as one of the best puzzle-adventure games of all time.

## Sales and accolades

The game was a commercial success, and has sold over 1 million copies worldwide. The game has also received numerous awards and accolades, including several Game of the Year awards.

# Legacy

Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective has had a lasting impact on the gaming industry, and is widely regarded as a classic of the puzzle-adventure genre. The game's unique gameplay mechanics and quirky characters have influenced numerous other games, and the game remains a beloved favorite among gamers and puzzle enthusiasts.

Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective is a unique and engaging game that is sure to appeal to fans of puzzle-adventure games. With its quirky characters, engaging story, and challenging puzzles, the game is a must-play for anyone looking for a fun and challenging gaming experience.

article:
2023 SAG-AFTRA Strike

The 2023 SAG-AFTRA strike was a labor dispute involving the Screen Actors Guild-American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (SAG-AFTRA), a labor union that represents approximately 160,000 film and television actors, journalists, radio personalities, recording artists, singers, and other media professionals. The strike, which began on July 14, 2023, and lasted for several months, was one of the largest and most significant labor disputes in the entertainment industry in recent years.

# Background

## Unionization in Hollywood

Unionization in Hollywood dates back to the early 20th century, when actors, writers, and directors began organizing to improve their working conditions, salaries, and benefits. The Screen Actors Guild (SAG) was founded in 1933, and over the years, it merged with other unions, including the American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (AFTRA), to form SAG-AFTRA in 2012. Today, SAG-AFTRA is one of the largest and most influential entertainment unions in the world.

## Pre-strike activity

In the months leading up to the strike, SAG-AFTRA engaged in negotiations with the Alliance of Motion Picture and Television Producers (AMPTP), a trade association that represents major film and television producers. The union was seeking improved pay, benefits, and working conditions for its members, as well as greater control over the use of their work in the digital age. However, the negotiations broke down, and SAG-AFTRA announced that it would go on strike if its demands were not met.

# Timeline

## July

The strike began on July 14, 2023, with SAG-AFTRA members picketing outside major film and television studios in Los Angeles and New York City. The strike was supported by other entertainment unions, including the Writers Guild of America (WGA) and the Directors Guild of America (DGA).

## August

In August, the strike began to have a significant impact on the entertainment industry, with many film and television productions shutting down or being delayed. The strike also began to attract attention from politicians and media executives, who urged the parties to negotiate a settlement.

## September

In September, SAG-AFTRA and the AMPTP resumed negotiations, but the talks broke down again. The strike continued, with SAG-AFTRA members picketing and rallying outside studios and other industry events.

## October

In October, the strike began to have a significant impact on the television industry, with many shows being delayed or canceled. The strike also began to attract attention from other industries, including the video game industry, where actors and writers were also seeking improved pay and benefits.

## November

In November, SAG-AFTRA and the AMPTP resumed negotiations again, but the talks broke down once more. The strike continued, with SAG-AFTRA members picketing and rallying outside studios and other industry events.

## December

In December, the strike finally came to an end, with SAG-AFTRA and the AMPTP reaching a tentative agreement. The agreement, which was ratified by SAG-AFTRA members in January 2024, provided for improved pay, benefits, and working conditions for actors and other media professionals.

# Strike activity and responses

## Locations

The strike took place at various locations throughout the United States, including Los Angeles, New York City, Chicago, and Atlanta. SAG-AFTRA members picketed outside major film and television studios, as well as other industry events.

## Media executives' response

Media executives responded to the strike by urging the parties to negotiate a settlement. Many executives expressed concern about the impact of the strike on the entertainment industry, including the delay or cancellation of film and television productions.

## Politicians' response

Politicians also responded to the strike, with many expressing support for SAG-AFTRA and its members. Some politicians urged the parties to negotiate a settlement, while others introduced legislation to support the entertainment industry.

## Other unions' response

Other entertainment unions, including the WGA and the DGA, supported the SAG-AFTRA strike. The unions issued statements of support and participated in picketing and other strike activities.

## Other organizations' response

Other organizations, including the AFL-CIO and the National Organization for Women, also supported the SAG-AFTRA strike. The organizations issued statements of support and participated in picketing and other strike activities.

## Impact

The strike had a significant impact on the entertainment industry, including the delay or cancellation of film and television productions. The strike also had an impact on the economy, with many businesses affected by the strike.

# Aftermath

The strike had a lasting impact on the entertainment industry, with many actors and other media professionals benefiting from the improved pay, benefits, and working conditions provided by the tentative agreement. The strike also had an impact on the video game industry, where actors and writers were also seeking improved pay and benefits.

article:
George Meade
================

George Gordon Meade was a career military officer and civil engineer who served as the commander of the Union Army's Army of the Potomac during the American Civil War. He is best known for his victory at the Battle of Gettysburg, which repelled the second invasion of the North by the Confederate Army of Northern Virginia, led by General Robert E. Lee.

Early life and education
------------------------

George Meade was born on December 31, 1815, in Cádiz, Spain, to Richard Worsam Meade and Margaret Coates Butler Meade. His father was a wealthy merchant who had served as a naval officer during the War of 1812. Meade's family returned to the United States when he was a young child and settled in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

Meade attended the Mount Hope Institution in Baltimore, Maryland, and later enrolled in the United States Military Academy at West Point, New York. He graduated from West Point in 1835, ranking 19th out of a class of 56 cadets. Meade was commissioned as a brevet second lieutenant in the United States Army Corps of Engineers.

Topographical Corps and Mexican-American War
------------------------------------------

Meade served in the United States Army Corps of Topographical Engineers, which was responsible for mapping and surveying the country's geography. He worked on several projects, including the survey of the Great Lakes and the construction of the Delaware Breakwater.

During the Mexican-American War, Meade served as a staff officer and participated in several battles, including the Battle of Palo Alto and the Battle of Resaca de la Palma. He was brevetted to the rank of captain for his actions during the war.

American Civil War
------------------

### Peninsula campaign

Meade was appointed as the commander of the 2nd Brigade of the Pennsylvania Reserves in 1861. He played a key role in the Peninsula campaign, which was a series of battles fought in Virginia in 1862. Meade's brigade was part of the Army of the Potomac, which was led by General George McClellan.

### Maryland campaign

In September 1862, Meade's brigade was part of the Army of the Potomac's invasion of Maryland. The army clashed with the Confederate Army of Northern Virginia, led by General Robert E. Lee, at the Battle of South Mountain. Meade's brigade was instrumental in defeating the Confederate forces and securing a Union victory.

### Fredericksburg and Chancellorsville

Meade's brigade fought at the Battle of Fredericksburg in December 1862, which was a decisive Confederate victory. He also fought at the Battle of Chancellorsville in May 1863, where the Confederate forces defeated the Army of the Potomac.

### Gettysburg campaign

#### Command of the Army of the Potomac

In June 1863, General Joseph Hooker resigned as the commander of the Army of the Potomac, and Meade was appointed as his replacement. Meade took command of the army just days before the Battle of Gettysburg, which was one of the bloodiest battles of the Civil War.

#### Battle of Gettysburg

The Battle of Gettysburg was fought from July 1 to July 3, 1863. Meade's Army of the Potomac clashed with Lee's Army of Northern Virginia in a series of battles around the town of Gettysburg, Pennsylvania. The Union forces ultimately emerged victorious, repelling the Confederate invasion of the North.

#### Lee's retreat

After the Battle of Gettysburg, Meade's Army of the Potomac pursued Lee's Army of Northern Virginia as it retreated back to Virginia. The Union forces were unable to catch the Confederate army, but they did force them to abandon their invasion of the North.

### Bristoe and Mine Run campaign

In the fall of 1863, Meade's Army of the Potomac launched a series of campaigns against the Confederate Army of Northern Virginia. The Bristoe campaign was a series of battles fought in Virginia, while the Mine Run campaign was a failed attempt to defeat the Confederate forces.

### Overland campaign

In the spring of 1864, Meade's Army of the Potomac launched the Overland campaign, which was a series of battles fought against the Confederate Army of Northern Virginia. The campaign was led by General Ulysses S. Grant, who had taken command of all Union forces in the Eastern Theater.

### Richmond-Petersburg campaign

The Richmond-Petersburg campaign was a series of battles fought in Virginia in 1864 and 1865. Meade's Army of the Potomac played a key role in the campaign, which ultimately led to the fall of the Confederate capital of Richmond.

### Political rivalries

Meade's leadership of the Army of the Potomac was often marked by controversy and rivalries with other generals. He clashed with General Joseph Hooker, who had previously commanded the army, and with General Ulysses S. Grant, who had taken command of all Union forces in the Eastern Theater.

Reconstruction
--------------

After the Civil War, Meade served as the commander of the Military Division of the Atlantic, which was responsible for overseeing the Reconstruction of the South. He played a key role in ensuring the safety and security of the region during a time of great turmoil and upheaval.

Personal life
-------------

Meade was married to Margaretta Sergeant Meade, and the couple had seven children together. He was a devout Episcopalian and attended church regularly.

Later life and death
-------------------

Meade died on November 6, 1872, at the age of 56, due to complications from pneumonia. He was buried in Laurel Hill Cemetery in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

Legacy
--------

Meade's legacy as a military commander is complex and often debated by historians. He is remembered for his victory at the Battle of Gettysburg, which was a turning point in the Civil War. However, he is also criticized for his cautious and defensive tactics, which often led to missed opportunities.

### Memorials to Meade

Meade is remembered through several memorials and monuments, including the Meade Memorial in Washington, D.C. and the General Meade Statue in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

In popular culture
----------------

Meade has been portrayed in numerous films and television shows, including the movie "Gettysburg" and the TV series "North and South". He has also been the subject of several books and biographies.

article:
She-Hulk: Attorney at Law is a Marvel Studios television series that premiered on Disney+ in 2022. The show is a comedy-drama that follows the life of Jennifer Walters, a lawyer who gains superhuman strength and durability after receiving a blood transfusion from her cousin, Bruce Banner, also known as the Hulk.

#Premise
The series follows Jennifer Walters, a successful lawyer who is struggling to balance her personal and professional life. After a car accident, Jennifer receives a blood transfusion from her cousin Bruce Banner, which contains his Hulk DNA. As a result, Jennifer gains superhuman strength and durability, becoming the She-Hulk. With her newfound powers, Jennifer must navigate the challenges of being a superhero while also dealing with the pressures of her law career.

#Cast and characters
The series features a talented ensemble cast, including:

* Tatiana Maslany as Jennifer Walters/She-Hulk
* Mark Ruffalo as Bruce Banner/Hulk
* Tim Roth as Emil Blonsky/Abomination
* Benedict Wong as Wong
* Ginger Gonzaga as Nikki Ramos
* Renée Elise Goldsberry as Mallory Book
* Jameela Jamil as Titania
* Josh Segarra as Augustus "Pug" Puglia
* Jon Bass as Todd Phelps

#Episodes

1. "A Normal Amount of Rage"
2. "Superhuman Law"
3. "The People vs. Emil Blonsky"

5. "Mean, Green, and Straight Poured into These Jeans"

9. "Whose Show Is This?"

#Production
The production of She-Hulk: Attorney at Law involved a team of experienced writers, directors, and producers.

##Development
The series was first announced in 2019, with Jessica Gao serving as the showrunner and head writer. Gao is a veteran writer and producer, having worked on shows such as Rick and Morty and Silicon Valley. The series was developed in collaboration with Marvel Studios, with Kevin Feige serving as an executive producer.

##Writing
The writing team for She-Hulk: Attorney at Law included a diverse group of writers, including Gao, Cody Ziglar, and Francesca Gailes. The team worked to develop a unique tone for the show, blending elements of comedy, drama, and superhero action.

##Casting
The casting process for the series involved a lengthy search for the right actress to play Jennifer Walters/She-Hulk. Tatiana Maslany was ultimately cast in the role, bringing her impressive range and versatility to the character. The rest of the cast was assembled over the course of several months, with Mark Ruffalo and Tim Roth signing on to reprise their roles as Bruce Banner/Hulk and Emil Blonsky/Abomination, respectively.

##Design
The design team for She-Hulk: Attorney at Law worked to create a unique visual style for the show, blending elements of superhero action and comedy. The team included costume designer Ann Foley, production designer Melanie Jones, and visual effects supervisor Shannon Justison.

##Filming
Principal photography for the series took place in Atlanta, Georgia, over the course of several months. The shoot involved a combination of studio and location work, with the cast and crew working to bring the world of She-Hulk to life.

##Post-production
Post-production for the series involved a team of experienced editors, visual effects artists, and sound designers. The team worked to assemble the episodes, adding music, sound effects, and visual effects to bring the show to life.

##Music
The music for She-Hulk: Attorney at Law was composed by Amie Doherty, who worked to create a unique score for the show. The score blended elements of comedy, drama, and superhero action, perfectly capturing the tone of the series.

#Marketing
The marketing campaign for She-Hulk: Attorney at Law involved a combination of traditional and social media advertising. The campaign included trailers, TV spots, and print ads, as well as a strong social media presence.

#Release
She-Hulk: Attorney at Law premiered on Disney+ on August 18, 2022. The series was released on a weekly schedule, with new episodes dropping every Thursday.

#Reception
The series received a positive reception from critics and audiences alike.

##Viewership
The series was a ratings success, with millions of viewers tuning in each week. According to Disney+, the series was one of the most-watched shows on the platform, with a strong and dedicated fan base.

##Critical response
The series received widespread critical acclaim, with praise for the writing, acting, and direction. The show was praised for its unique tone and blend of comedy, drama, and superhero action.

##Accolades
The series received several award nominations, including a Critics' Choice Television Award nomination for Best Actress in a Comedy Series for Tatiana Maslany.

#Documentary special
A documentary special, Marvel Studios Assembled: The Making of She-Hulk: Attorney at Law, was released on Disney+ in 2022. The special provided a behind-the-scenes look at the making of the series, featuring interviews with the cast and crew.

#Future
A second season of She-Hulk: Attorney at Law has been announced, with production set to begin in 2023.

2022 French Presidential Election

The 2022 French presidential election was held on 10 and 24 April 2022. The election was the 12th presidential election of the Fifth Republic and the first round was held on 10 April, with the second round taking place two weeks later. The incumbent president, Emmanuel Macron, sought re-election for a second term, facing off against Marine Le Pen, the president of the National Rally, in the second round. Macron ultimately won the election, securing a second term as president.

#Electoral system

The French presidential election is held using a two-round system, in which a candidate must receive a majority of the votes cast in the first round to win outright. If no candidate achieves this, the top two candidates with the most votes proceed to a second round, in which the candidate with the most votes is elected. The election is also subject to a number of other rules and regulations, including a requirement that candidates must be sponsored by at least 500 elected officials, known as "parrainages," in order to appear on the ballot.

#First round

##Campaign

The campaign for the first round of the presidential election began in earnest in the autumn of 2021, with a number of candidates announcing their intention to run. The campaign was marked by a number of issues, including the COVID-19 pandemic, the economic recovery, and the question of Europe. The candidates also clashed on issues such as immigration, security, and the environment.

##Primaries and congresses

A number of parties held primaries or congresses to select their candidate for the presidential election.

###Ecologist primary

The ecologist primary was held in September and October 2021, and was won by Yannick Jadot, a former MEP and the president of the Europe Ecology - The Greens party.

###Socialist primary

The Socialist Party held a primary in January 2022, which was won by Anne Hidalgo, the mayor of Paris.

###People's Primary

The People's Primary was a citizens' primary held in January and February 2022, which was won by Christiane Taubira, a former justice minister.

###The Republicans congress

The Republicans held a congress in December 2021, which was won by Valérie Pécresse, the president of the Île-de-France region.

##Candidates

A total of 12 candidates appeared on the ballot for the first round of the presidential election.

###Sponsorships

In order to appear on the ballot, candidates were required to secure the sponsorship of at least 500 elected officials. A number of candidates struggled to secure the required number of sponsorships, including the left-wing candidate, Jean-Luc Mélenchon.

##Electorate

The electorate for the presidential election consisted of all French citizens aged 18 and over who were registered to vote. A total of 48.7 million people were registered to vote in the election.

#Second round

##Endorsements

Following the first round, a number of candidates endorsed either Macron or Le Pen. The socialist candidate, Anne Hidalgo, endorsed Macron, while the ecologist candidate, Yannick Jadot, called on his supporters to vote against Le Pen.

##Campaign

The campaign for the second round of the presidential election was marked by a number of issues, including the economy, security, and the environment. Macron and Le Pen clashed in a televised debate, which was watched by millions of people.

##Candidates

The two candidates who proceeded to the second round were Emmanuel Macron and Marine Le Pen.

#Opinion polls

##First round

Opinion polls were published throughout the campaign, and showed a number of different candidates in the lead at different times. However, Macron and Le Pen were consistently shown to be the two front-runners.

##Second round

article:
Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey
==========================

Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey is a 2023 American independent slasher film written and directed by Rhys Frake-Waterfield. The film is a horror adaptation of A.A. Milne's Winnie-the-Pooh stories, with the titular character and his friends reimagined as killers. The film premiered on February 15, 2023, and received mixed reviews from critics.

Plot
-----

The film takes place in the Hundred Acre Wood, where Winnie-the-Pooh (played by Craig David Dowsett) and his friends, including Piglet (played by Chris Cordell), Eeyore (played by Natasha Tosini), and Tigger (played by Richard D. Myers), have become violent and deranged after being abandoned by their owner, Christopher Robin (played by Frederick Hazeldine). The group begins to terrorize and kill anyone who enters their forest, including a group of college students who venture into the woods.

As the film progresses, it becomes clear that Pooh and his friends are not just mindless killers, but are instead driven by a twisted desire for revenge against those who wronged them. The film's climax features a confrontation between Pooh and Christopher Robin, who has returned to the forest to confront his former friends.

Cast

* Craig David Dowsett as Winnie-the-Pooh
* Chris Cordell as Piglet
* Natasha Tosini as Eeyore
* Richard D. Myers as Tigger
* Frederick Hazeldine as Christopher Robin
* Amber Doig-Thorne as Tina
* Danielle Scott as Maria
* Maria Taylor as Jess
* Danielle Ronald as Zoe

Production
------------

### Development

Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey was written and directed by Rhys Frake-Waterfield, a British filmmaker who had previously worked on several low-budget horror films. Frake-Waterfield was inspired to create the film after realizing that the Winnie-the-Pooh characters were no longer under copyright in the United Kingdom. He saw an opportunity to create a unique horror film that would subvert the expectations of audiences who were familiar with the original stories.

Frake-Waterfield worked with a small team of producers to develop the film, including Scott Jeffrey and Jefferson Stewart. The film's budget was reportedly around $100,000, which is extremely low for a feature film.

### Filming

Principal photography for Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey took place in the summer of 2022, in various locations in the United Kingdom. The film was shot on a tight schedule, with the cast and crew working long hours to complete the film on time.

The film's special effects were created by a team of makeup artists and special effects experts, who worked to create the iconic characters from the Winnie-the-Pooh stories. The film's gore effects were also created by the same team, who used a combination of practical effects and CGI to create the film's bloody and violent scenes.

### Music

The film's score was composed by Andrew Scott Bell, a British composer who had previously worked on several low-budget horror films. Bell's score was designed to be a dark and ominous complement to the film's on-screen action, and features a mix of electronic and orchestral elements.

Release
--------

### Marketing

Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey was marketed as a horror film that would appeal to fans of the genre. The film's trailer was released online in January 2023, and featured a mix of violent and disturbing scenes from the film. The trailer was widely shared on social media, and helped to generate buzz for the film.

The film's poster was designed by a team of graphic designers, who created a eye-catching image that featured Winnie-the-Pooh as a menacing and violent character. The poster was widely shared online, and helped to generate interest in the film.

### Home media

Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey was released on DVD and Blu-ray on March 15, 2023, by a small independent distributor. The film's home media release featured a mix of bonus features, including a behind-the-scenes documentary and a commentary track with the film's director.

Reception
----------

### Box office

Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey was released in a limited capacity, and did not perform well at the box office. The film grossed around $10,000 in its opening weekend, and went on to gross a total of around $50,000 worldwide.

Despite the film's poor box office performance, it has developed a cult following among fans of horror films. The film's unique premise and violent scenes have made it a favorite among fans of the genre.

### Critical response

Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey received mixed reviews from critics. Some reviewers praised the film's unique premise and violent scenes, while others criticized the film's low budget and poor production values.

The film holds a 40% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 20 reviews. The site's critical consensus reads: "Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey is a messy and uneven horror film that fails to live up to its promising premise."

### Accolades

Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey did not receive any major awards or nominations.

Future

### Sequel

A sequel to Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey is currently in development, with Rhys Frake-Waterfield set to return as writer and director. The sequel will reportedly feature a new group of characters, and will expand on the universe created in the first film.

article:
2022 Russian Mobilization

On September 21, 2022, Russian President Vladimir Putin announced a partial mobilization of the country's military reserves in a televised address, marking a significant escalation of Russia's involvement in the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. The mobilization effort was aimed at bolstering Russia's military presence in Ukraine and addressing the country's mounting losses in the war. This article provides an overview of the background, prelude, and implementation of the 2022 Russian mobilization, as well as the reactions and analysis of the move.

# Background

## Donetsk and Luhansk People's Republics

The conflict in Ukraine began in 2014, when pro-Russian separatists declared independence in the Donetsk and Luhansk regions. Russia has provided military and economic support to the separatists, while Ukraine and its Western allies have accused Russia of fueling the conflict. In February 2022, Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine, sparking a broader conflict that has resulted in significant human suffering and economic damage.

## Russia

Russia's military involvement in Ukraine has come at a significant cost, with estimates suggesting that the country has lost thousands of troops and billions of dollars in equipment and resources. Despite these losses, Russia has continued to press its advantage in Ukraine, using its military might to gain control over key cities and territories.

### Russian losses

Russia's losses in Ukraine have been substantial, with estimates suggesting that the country has lost over 10,000 troops and billions of dollars in equipment and resources. The losses have put a strain on Russia's military, which has struggled to replace lost equipment and personnel. The mobilization effort is aimed at addressing these losses and bolstering Russia's military presence in Ukraine.

# Prelude

## Volunteer recruitment campaign

In the months leading up to the mobilization, Russia launched a volunteer recruitment campaign aimed at attracting new recruits to the military. The campaign was aimed at young men, with promises of high pay and benefits for those who enlisted. However, the campaign was met with skepticism by many, who saw it as an attempt to distract from the country's mounting losses in Ukraine.

## Legislative changes

In the weeks leading up to the mobilization, Russia's parliament passed a series of legislative changes aimed at supporting the country's military efforts. The changes included increased funding for the military, as well as new laws aimed at cracking down on dissent and opposition.

## Recruitment of prisoners

In a move that sparked widespread controversy, Russia began recruiting prisoners to fight in Ukraine. The recruitment effort was aimed at prisoners who had served time for non-violent crimes, and was seen as an attempt to bolster Russia's military presence in Ukraine. However, the move was met with widespread criticism, with many arguing that it was a desperate attempt to address Russia's mounting losses.

# Putin's speech

On September 21, 2022, Russian President Vladimir Putin delivered a televised address in which he announced the partial mobilization of Russia's military reserves. The speech was seen as a significant escalation of Russia's involvement in Ukraine, and marked a turning point in the conflict.

# Decree

article:
Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery

Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery is a 2022 mystery film written and directed by Rian Johnson. The film is a sequel to the 2019 film Knives Out and features an ensemble cast, including Daniel Craig, Edward Norton, Janelle Monáe, Kathryn Hahn, Leslie Odom Jr., Jessica Henwick, Madelyn Cline, Kate Hudson, and Dave Bautista.

# Plot

The film takes place in 2022, during the COVID-19 pandemic. The story follows Benoit Blanc (Daniel Craig), a renowned private detective, who is invited to a private island by tech billionaire Miles Bron (Edward Norton). Miles has planned a murder mystery game for his closest friends, which includes a governor (Kathryn Hahn), a scientist (Leslie Odom Jr.), a journalist (Kate Hudson), a model (Madelyn Cline), and a gaming streamer (Dave Bautista). However, the game takes an unexpected turn when the group finds themselves embroiled in a real-life murder investigation.

As the investigation unfolds, Blanc uncovers a web of secrets and lies that lead him to suspect each member of the group. Along the way, he teams up with Andi Brand (Janelle Monáe), Miles's business partner and ex-girlfriend, who has her own motives for being on the island. Through a series of twists and turns, Blanc must use his exceptional detective skills to unravel the mystery and uncover the truth behind the murder.

# Cast

* Daniel Craig as Benoit Blanc
* Edward Norton as Miles Bron
* Janelle Monáe as Andi Brand
* Kathryn Hahn as Claire Debella
* Leslie Odom Jr. as Lionel Toussaint
* Jessica Henwick as Peg
* Madelyn Cline as Whiskey
* Kate Hudson as Birdie Jay
* Dave Bautista as Duke Cody

# Production

## Development

Rian Johnson had expressed interest in creating a sequel to Knives Out shortly after the film's release in 2019. In March 2021, it was announced that Johnson would write and direct the sequel, with Daniel Craig set to reprise his role as Benoit Blanc. The film was produced by Johnson and Ram Bergman under their production company, T-Street Productions.

## Writing

Johnson began working on the script in 2020, during the COVID-19 pandemic. He drew inspiration from his own experiences during the pandemic, as well as classic detective novels and films. Johnson has stated that he wanted to create a sequel that would be distinct from the original film, while still maintaining the same tone and style.

## Casting

In addition to Daniel Craig, several new cast members were announced in March 2021, including Edward Norton, Janelle Monáe, Kathryn Hahn, Leslie Odom Jr., and Dave Bautista. The cast was rounded out by Jessica Henwick, Madelyn Cline, and Kate Hudson, who were announced in May 2021.

## Filming

Principal photography began in June 2021, on the island of Spetses, Greece. The film was shot on location, with additional scenes filmed in the United States. The production team built a large set on the island, which served as the exterior of Miles Bron's private villa.

## Music

The film's score was composed by Nathan Johnson, Rian Johnson's cousin. The score features a mix of jazz and classical music, which pays homage to the classic detective films that inspired the movie.

# Release

## Marketing

The film's marketing campaign began in June 2022, with the release of a teaser trailer. The trailer featured a brief glimpse of the film's ensemble cast, as well as a hint of the mystery that drives the plot.

## Theatrical and streaming

Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery was released in theaters on November 23, 2022, for a one-week limited engagement. The film was then released on Netflix on December 23, 2022.

## Home media

The film was released on DVD and Blu-ray in March 2023.

# Reception

## Box office

The film grossed $15 million at the domestic box office during its limited theatrical run. The film's streaming release on Netflix was also successful, with the film becoming one of the most-watched titles on the platform.

## Critical response

The film received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the film's clever script, strong performances, and clever twists. The film holds a 92% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 220 reviews.

## Themes

The film explores several themes, including the corrupting influence of wealth and power, the dangers of toxic masculinity, and the importance of female friendship and empowerment. The film also touches on the COVID-19 pandemic, using it as a backdrop to explore the characters' personal struggles and relationships.

## Accolades

The film received several award nominations, including two Golden Globe nominations for Best Actor in a Motion Picture – Drama (Daniel Craig) and Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture (Janelle Monáe).

# Sequel

A third installment in the Knives Out franchise is currently in development, with Rian Johnson set to write and direct. The film is expected to feature Daniel Craig reprising his role as Benoit Blanc, although no official release date has been announced.

article:
Seymour Hersh
================

Seymour Myron Hersh is an American investigative journalist and author known for his exposés on government wrongdoing and military scandals. He has written extensively on the military-industrial complex, intelligence agencies, and foreign policy, often relying on anonymous sources to reveal sensitive information. Throughout his career, Hersh has been praised for his tenacity and criticized for his methods, earning him both admiration and controversy.

Early life and education
------------------------

Seymour Hersh was born on April 8, 1937, in Chicago, Illinois, to a Jewish family of Romanian and Polish descent. His parents, Isador and Dorothy Hersh, were both high school graduates who owned a dry cleaning business. Hersh grew up in a middle-class neighborhood on the South Side of Chicago, where he developed an interest in journalism at an early age. He attended the University of Chicago, where he studied history and graduated in 1958.

Newspaper career
-----------------

After college, Hersh worked as a police reporter for the City News Bureau of Chicago, covering crime and corruption in the city. In 1963, he moved to Washington, D.C., to work as a reporter for the Associated Press (AP), covering the Pentagon and national security issues.

### My Lai massacre

In 1969, Hersh broke the story of the My Lai Massacre, in which American soldiers killed hundreds of unarmed Vietnamese civilians in the village of My Lai. His investigative reporting, which included interviews with soldiers and eyewitnesses, revealed the atrocities committed by the U.S. military during the Vietnam War. The story won him the Pulitzer Prize for International Reporting in 1970.

### The New York Times

In 1972, Hersh joined The New York Times as a investigative reporter, where he covered national security and foreign policy issues. During his time at the Times, he wrote extensively on the CIA, NSA, and other intelligence agencies, often relying on anonymous sources to reveal sensitive information. His reporting led to several high-profile exposés, including the CIA's domestic spying program and the NSA's surveillance of American citizens.

Investigative books: 1980s and 1990s
------------------------------------------

In the 1980s and 1990s, Hersh turned his attention to writing books, many of which became bestsellers. His first book, "The Price of Power: Kissinger in the Nixon White House," was published in 1983 and examined the role of Henry Kissinger in shaping U.S. foreign policy during the Nixon administration.

Other notable books from this period include "The Target Is Destroyed" (1986), which explored the Soviet downing of Korean Air Lines Flight 007, and "The Samson Option" (1991), which revealed Israel's nuclear program.

Later investigations
--------------------

### Iraq and Abu Ghraib

In 2004, Hersh wrote a series of articles for The New Yorker on the Abu Ghraib prison abuse scandal, in which American soldiers tortured and abused Iraqi detainees. His reporting revealed the widespread nature of the abuse and the involvement of high-ranking military officials.

### Iran

In 2006, Hersh wrote about the Bush administration's plans to attack Iran, citing anonymous sources within the military and intelligence communities. He also reported on the CIA's secret operations in Iran, including the use of proxy forces to destabilize the government.

### Syria and chemical attacks

In 2013, Hersh wrote about the Syrian government's alleged use of chemical weapons, citing anonymous sources who disputed the official narrative. He also reported on the role of Saudi Arabia and other Gulf states in funding and arming rebel groups in Syria.

### Killing of Osama bin Laden

In 2015, Hersh wrote a controversial article disputing the official account of the killing of Osama bin Laden, citing anonymous sources who claimed that the raid was not a firefight, as reported by the Obama administration, but a pre-planned assassination.

### Nord Stream pipeline and Ukraine

In 2022, Hersh wrote about the destruction of the Nord Stream pipeline, citing anonymous sources who claimed that the U.S. was involved in the sabotage. He also reported on the role of the U.S. in Ukraine, including the provision of military aid and intelligence support to the Ukrainian government.

Other statements
-----------------

### Speeches

Hersh has given numerous speeches and lectures on journalism, national security, and foreign policy. In 2015, he gave a speech at the London School of Economics, in which he criticized the media for its complicity in government propaganda and its failure to hold those in power accountable.

### Murder of Seth Rich

In 2017, Hersh made headlines for his claims about the murder of Democratic National Committee staffer Seth Rich, citing anonymous sources who claimed that Rich was in contact with WikiLeaks and had provided them with leaked emails.

### Pat Nixon abuse

In 2018, Hersh wrote about the alleged abuse of Pat Nixon by her husband, Richard Nixon, citing anonymous sources who claimed that Nixon had physically and emotionally abused his wife throughout their marriage.

Use of anonymous sources
-------------------------

Hersh has been criticized for his reliance on anonymous sources, which some have argued makes it difficult to verify the accuracy of his reporting. However, Hersh has defended his use of anonymous sources, arguing that they are often the only way to get information about sensitive topics.

Personal life
--------------

Hersh is married to Elizabeth Sarah Klein, a lawyer, and has three children. He lives in Washington, D.C., and is known for his reclusive nature, rarely giving interviews or making public appearances.

Awards and honors
-----------------

Hersh has won numerous awards for his journalism, including the Pulitzer Prize, the Polk Award, and the National Magazine Award. He has also been inducted into the National Press Club's Hall of Fame.

Publications
-------------

### Books

* "Chemical and Biological Warfare" (1968)
* "My Lai 4: A Report on the Massacre and Its Aftermath" (1970)
* "Cover-Up: The Army's Secret Investigation of the Massacre at My Lai 4" (1972)
* "The Price of Power: Kissinger in the Nixon White House" (1983)
* "The Target Is Destroyed" (1986)
* "The Samson Option" (1991)
* "The Dark Side of Camelot" (1997)
* "Against All Enemies: Gulf War Syndrome: The War Between America's Ailing Veterans and Their Government" (1998)
* "Chain of Command: The Road from 9/11 to Abu Ghraib" (2004)
* "The Killing of Osama Bin Laden" (2016)

### Articles

Hersh has written numerous articles for The New Yorker, The New York Times, and other publications.

2023 SAFF Championship

The 2023 SAFF Championship, also known as the 2023 South Asian Football Federation Championship, is the 13th edition of the SAFF Championship, the biennial international men's football championship of South Asia organized by the South Asian Football Federation (SAFF). The tournament is scheduled to take place in India from June 21 to July 4, 2023.

# Host selection

India was announced as the host of the 2023 SAFF Championship by the South Asian Football Federation (SAFF) on February 14, 2023. This will be the third time India hosts the tournament, after previously hosting it in 1997 and 2011.

# Participating nations

Seven teams from the South Asian region will participate in the tournament. The participating teams are:

*  Bangladesh
*  Bhutan
*  India
*  Kuwait (invited team)
*  Maldives
*  Nepal
*  Pakistan

Each participating team is required to submit a squad of 23 players, including three goalkeepers. The squads for the 2023 SAFF Championship will be announced by the respective teams before the start of the tournament.

# Venue

The 2023 SAFF Championship will be held at the Sree Kanteerava Stadium in Bengaluru, India. The stadium has a seating capacity of 24,000 and has hosted several international football matches in the past.

article:
E.A.T. (TV program)

E.A.T. is a Philippine television variety show that has been on the air since 1979. It is one of the longest-running television shows in the country, with a history spanning over four decades. The show has undergone several format changes, network transfers, and hosting lineups throughout its run.

# History

## RPN (1979–1989)

E.A.T. premiered on July 30, 1979, on RPN (Radio Philippines Network) as a noontime variety show hosted by Tito Sotto, Vic Sotto, and Joey de Leon. The show's initial format featured a mix of comedy sketches, musical performances, and interviews with celebrity guests. During its early years, E.A.T. gained popularity for its irreverent humor and wacky antics, which resonated with Filipino audiences.

## ABS-CBN (1989–1995)

In 1989, E.A.T. transferred to ABS-CBN (Alto Broadcasting System-Chronicle Broadcasting Network) and underwent a significant format change. The show's hosts, Tito Sotto, Vic Sotto, and Joey de Leon, remained the same, but the program's content shifted towards a more entertainment-focused format. E.A.T. became known for its elaborate musical numbers, dance performances, and comedy sketches.

## GMA Network (1995–2024)

In 1995, E.A.T. transferred to GMA Network (Global Media Arts Network) and continued to evolve in terms of its format and content. The show's hosts, Tito Sotto, Vic Sotto, and Joey de Leon, remained the mainstays of the program, but new segments and features were introduced to cater to changing audience preferences. During its run on GMA, E.A.T. became one of the network's flagship programs and a major ratings success.

## TVJ - TAPE Inc. conflict (2023–2024)

In 2023, a controversy erupted between the hosts of E.A.T., Tito Sotto, Vic Sotto, and Joey de Leon (collectively known as TVJ), and the show's production company, TAPE Inc. The conflict revolved around issues of creative control, contracts, and intellectual property rights.

### E.A.T. and TAPE's Eat Bulaga!

At the center of the controversy was the fact that TAPE Inc. had been producing a competing noontime variety show, Eat Bulaga!, which aired on GMA Network. Eat Bulaga! was hosted by Vic Sotto, Joey de Leon, and Tito Sotto, among others, and had been on the air since 1995. The similarity in names and formats between E.A.T. and Eat Bulaga! led to allegations of plagiarism and intellectual property theft.

### Eat Bulaga! trademark battle: TVJ emerges victorious

In 2024, the Intellectual Property Office of the Philippines (IPOPHL) ruled in favor of TVJ, declaring that the name "Eat Bulaga!" was not a registered trademark of TAPE Inc. The decision effectively allowed TVJ to continue using the name "E.A.T." for their show, while TAPE Inc. was forced to drop the name "Eat Bulaga!" for their competing program.

## TV5 and RPTV (since 2024)

In 2024, E.A.T. transferred to TV5 (The 5 Network) and RPTV (Regional Philippine Television), marking the show's fifth network transfer in its over 40-year history. The show's hosts, Tito Sotto, Vic Sotto, and Joey de Leon, remained the same, but the program's format underwent significant changes to adapt to the new network's programming strategy.

# Hosts

## Current host

* Tito Sotto
* Vic Sotto
* Joey de Leon

## Former host

* Aiza Seguerra (1995–2004)

# Segments

## Current segments

### Sugod Bahay, Mga Kapatid!

A game segment where contestants compete to win cash prizes and other rewards.

### Gimme 5: Laro ng mga Henyo

A trivia segment where contestants answer questions to win cash prizes.

### Peraphy

A comedy segment featuring wacky characters and sketches.

### Barangay Bulagaan

A talent segment where contestants showcase their skills in singing, dancing, and other performances.

### Dear Eat Bulaga

A advice segment where hosts answer questions and provide advice to viewers.

### Eat Bulaga Olympics

A sports segment featuring hosts competing in various games and challenges.

### Bawal! Judgmental Ka Ba?

A comedy segment featuring hosts playing pranks on each other.

## Concluded segments

### Mr. Cutie: Boys Got Talent (2023–2024)

A talent segment featuring male contestants competing in singing and dancing performances.

### Babala! 'Wag Kayong Ganuuun... (2023–2024)

A comedy segment featuring hosts playing pranks on each other.

### That's My Boyfriend (2024)

A game segment where contestants compete to win cash prizes.

### Rewind: The Comeback Stage (2024)

A talent segment featuring contestants competing in singing and dancing performances.

### EB Centerstage

A variety segment featuring hosts performing in musical numbers and comedy sketches.

### Barangay Cinema: Child Star of the Year (2024)

A talent segment featuring child contestants competing in acting and singing performances.

# Ratings

E.A.T. has consistently been one of the top-rated television programs in the Philippines, with a peak rating of 25.4% in 2019, according to Kantar Media.

# Controversies

E.A.T. has been involved in several controversies throughout its run, including allegations of plagiarism, intellectual property theft, and contract disputes.

# Spin-offs

## Eat Na Ta!

A spin-off of E.A.T. that aired on GMA Network from 2019 to 2020.

## International versions

### Eat Bulaga! Indonesia and The New Eat Bulaga! Indonesia

Indonesian versions of E.A.T. that aired on SCTV and MNCTV, respectively.

### Eat Bulaga! Myanmar

A Burmese version of E.A.T. that aired on MRTV.

# Notes

E.A.T. has won several awards, including the Best Variety Show award at the 2019 Philippine Television Awards.

# References

This article is entirely based on publicly available information and does not include any citations or references.

article:
Gilles de Rais

Gilles de Rais (1404 – 26 October 1440) was a French nobleman, military leader, and alleged serial killer. He is best known for his involvement in the Hundred Years' War and his subsequent trial and execution for the murders of numerous children. De Rais's life and crimes have been the subject of much speculation and debate, with some regarding him as a pioneering figure in the history of serial killing, while others have questioned the validity of the charges brought against him.

#House of Retz

##Early life

Gilles de Rais was born in 1404 at the Château de Champtocé, in the province of Anjou, France. He was a member of the powerful and influential House of Retz, a noble family with extensive lands and titles in western France. De Rais's early life is not well documented, but it is believed that he received a conventional noble education, studying Latin, literature, and martial skills.

##Matrimonial projects

In 1420, de Rais married Catherine de Thouars, a member of another prominent noble family. The marriage was likely arranged by de Rais's family to secure alliances and consolidate their power. However, the union was childless, and de Rais eventually became embroiled in a series of disputes with his wife's family over land and titles.

##Family disputes

De Rais's family disputes intensified over the years, particularly with his cousin, Jean de Craon, who sought to limit de Rais's power and influence. These conflicts ultimately led to a series of armed confrontations and lawsuits, which de Rais largely lost. Despite these setbacks, de Rais continued to accumulate wealth and titles, becoming one of the most powerful nobles in western France.

##Titles, estates and wealth

At the height of his power, de Rais held numerous titles, including Baron of Retz, Lord of Craon, and Marshal of France. He also owned extensive estates and lands, including the Château de Machecoul, which became his favorite residence. De Rais's wealth was largely derived from his military campaigns and his control of various castles and fortifications along the French-Breton border.

#Military career

##First hypothetical feat of arms

De Rais's military career began in the 1420s, when he fought alongside his uncle, Amaury de Craon, in a series of skirmishes against the English. Although the details of these early campaigns are unclear, it is believed that de Rais quickly distinguished himself as a skilled and courageous warrior.

##Franco-Breton alliance through the House of Valois-Anjou

In 1429, de Rais became embroiled in the Franco-Breton alliance, a complex web of alliances and rivalries between the French crown, the Duchy of Brittany, and the House of Valois-Anjou. De Rais's involvement in this alliance led to his participation in several key battles, including the siege of Orléans, where he fought alongside Joan of Arc.

##Guerilla warfare against English garrisons on the borders of Maine

De Rais's military campaigns against the English garrisons on the borders of Maine were marked by a series of bold and innovative tactics. He employed guerrilla warfare, ambushes, and other unconventional methods to harass and disrupt the English supply lines.

##Companion in arms with Joan of Arc

De Rais's relationship with Joan of Arc is still a subject of debate among historians. While some accounts suggest that de Rais was a close companion and supporter of Joan, others portray him as a rival or even an enemy. Regardless, it is clear that de Rais fought alongside Joan during the siege of Orléans and shared her vision for a united France.

##Civil wars between La Trémoille and Richemont's allies

In the 1430s, de Rais became embroiled in the civil wars between La Trémoille and Richemont's allies, a complex series of conflicts that pitted various factions against each other. De Rais ultimately sided with La Trémoille, but the conflict weakened his power and influence.

##Lifting of the siege of Lagny

In 1432, de Rais participated in the lifting of the siege of Lagny, a key victory for the French crown. Although the details of his role in the battle are unclear, it is believed that de Rais played a significant part in the French success.

##Reduction of military commitments

In the late 1430s, de Rais began to reduce his military commitments, focusing instead on his estates and personal affairs. This decision was likely driven by a combination of factors, including his declining health and the increasingly complex web of alliances and rivalries that characterized the French court.

#Squandering of heritage

De Rais's decision to reduce his military commitments marked the beginning of a period of decline and squandering of his heritage. He became increasingly reckless and extravagant, squandering his wealth on lavish parties, expensive clothing, and other indulgences.

#Criminal life

##Occult involvement

De Rais's involvement in the occult is still a subject of debate among historians. While some accounts suggest that he was deeply involved in various forms of magic and sorcery, others portray him as a skeptical and rational individual. Regardless, it is clear that de Rais was fascinated by the occult and explored various forms of mysticism and spirituality.

##Child murders

The charges of child murder brought against de Rais are still a subject of debate and speculation. While some accounts suggest that he was a serial killer who murdered dozens of children, others portray him as a victim of circumstance and false accusations. Regardless, it is clear that de Rais was accused of numerous crimes, including the murder of several children.

##Act of force in Saint-Étienne-de-Mer-Morte

In 1439, de Rais was accused of an act of force in Saint-Étienne-de-Mer-Morte, a small village in western France. The details of the incident are unclear, but it is believed that de Rais was involved in a violent confrontation with a group of villagers.

##Ecclesiastical and secular investigations

De Rais's crimes were investigated by both ecclesiastical and secular authorities, who gathered evidence and testimony from various witnesses. The investigations were marked by a series of irregularities and inconsistencies, which have led some to question the validity of the charges brought against de Rais.

##Trial and execution

De Rais was tried and executed in 1440, after a lengthy and complex trial. The details of the trial are unclear, but it is believed that de Rais was found guilty of numerous crimes, including murder, sodomy, and heresy.

#Question of guilt

##Doubts about the verdict in the Age of Enlightenment tradition

The guilt of de Rais has been the subject of much speculation and debate, particularly in the Age of Enlightenment tradition. Many historians have questioned the validity of the charges brought against de Rais, citing irregularities and inconsistencies in the trial and investigation.

##Occultist interpretations

Some occultist interpretations of de Rais's life and crimes portray him as a pioneering figure in the history of magic and sorcery. According to these accounts, de Rais was a deeply spiritual individual who explored various forms of mysticism and spirituality.

##Georges Bataille's interpretations

Georges Bataille's interpretations of de Rais's life and crimes portray him as a symbol of the darker aspects of human nature. According to Bataille, de Rais was a figure of excess and transgression, who embodied the contradictions and paradoxes of human existence.

##1992 mock re-trial

In 1992, a mock re-trial of de Rais was held in France, which found him not guilty of the charges brought against him. The trial was widely publicized and sparked a renewed debate about de Rais's guilt and innocence.

##Contemporary academic views

Contemporary academic views of de Rais's life and crimes are highly divided, reflecting the ongoing debate and speculation about his guilt and innocence. While some historians portray de Rais as a serial killer and a monster, others see him as a complex and multifaceted individual who was the victim of circumstance and false accusations.

#Fictional portraits

2022 Badminton Asia Championships

The 2022 Badminton Asia Championships was a continental badminton tournament held from April 26 to May 1, 2022, in Manila, Philippines. The championships were organized by the Badminton Asia Confederation (BAC) and saw participation from top Asian badminton players.

# Tournament

## Venue

The 2022 Badminton Asia Championships were held at the Muntinlupa Sports Complex in Manila, Philippines. The venue had a seating capacity of 5,000 spectators and was equipped with state-of-the-art facilities to host the championships.

## Point distribution

A total of 10,000 points were up for grabs in the championships, with the winner in each category receiving 10,000 points. The points were distributed as follows:

* Winner: 10,000 points
* Runner-up: 8,400 points
* Semifinalists: 6,400 points
* Quarterfinalists: 4,000 points

## Prize money

The total prize money for the 2022 Badminton Asia Championships was $400,000. The winners in each category received $30,000, while the runners-up received $15,000.

# Medal summary

## Medalists

The following players won medals in the 2022 Badminton Asia Championships:

* Men's singles: Lee Zii Jia (Malaysia) - Gold, Jonatan Christie (Indonesia) - Silver, Chico Aura Dwi Wardoyo (Indonesia) - Bronze, Kanta Tsuneyama (Japan) - Bronze
